intro: Sibbaldia erecta var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered sibbaldia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and grass-like, and it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. This species is often found in alpine and subalpine environments, where it contributes to the biodiversity of high-altitude ecosystems.
